Name: washington_dc_2005_blockply
Abstract: Unofficial Census blocks boundaries for the District of Columbia.  These boundaries were compiled from an unofficial U.S. Census TIGER/line product that reflects updates to the original TIGER boundaries based on planimetric data supplied by the District of Columbia.  This product is generally consistent with District of Columbia planimetric data, although boundary geometries are not identical, and often vary by 5 to 10 centimeters.
FgdcText:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<metadata>
  <idinfo>
    <citation>
      <citeinfo>
        <origin>US Census</origin>
        <pubdate>2003</pubdate>
        <title>Census blocks, Washington, DC 2003</title>
        <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>
      <ftname Sync="TRUE">washington_dc_2005_blockply</ftname>
</citeinfo>
    </citation>
    <descript>
      <abstract>Unofficial Census blocks boundaries for the District of Columbia.  These boundaries were compiled from an unofficial U.S. Census TIGER/line product that reflects updates to the original TIGER boundaries based on planimetric data supplied by the District of Columbia.  This product is generally consistent with District of Columbia planimetric data, although boundary geometries are not identical, and often vary by 5 to 10 centimeters.</abstract>
      <purpose>This data is used for mapping and analysis of information on population and housing in the District of Columbia.</purpose>
    </descript>
    <timeperd>
      <timeinfo>
        <sngdate>
          <caldate>2003</caldate>
        </sngdate>
      </timeinfo>
      <current>publication date</current>
    </timeperd>
    <status>
      <progress>In work</progress>
      <update>Irregular</update>
    </status>
    <spdom>
      <bounding>
        <westbc>-77.1199</westbc>
        <eastbc>-76.9093</eastbc>
        <northbc>38.9959</northbc>
        <southbc>38.7916</southbc>
      </bounding>
    </spdom>
    <keywords>
      <theme>
        <themekt>Census</themekt>
        <themekey>Geography	</themekey>
        <themekey>Demography</themekey>
        <themekey>Population</themekey>
      </theme>

    </keywords>

    <native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.780</native>
  </idinfo>
  <dataqual>
    <attracc>
      <attraccr>Staff reviewed the line work of the blocks with the 1:1200 scale snap base.  Staff identified 189 issues as follows:

- Blocks cut across buildings
- There are blocks within blocks
- Some blocks are multi-part features
- Blocks do not align to the snap base
- Boundaries for some blocks are different in the two source files.

These issues have been referred to the DC Office of Planning for resolution with the US Census Bureau.  Until a new, updated version is provided, this is the best block file.</attraccr>
    </attracc>
    <logic>No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted</logic>
    <complete>Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details</complete>
    <posacc>
      <horizpa>
        <horizpar>Boundaries are observed to be within 5 to 10 centimeters of District of Columbia planimetric boundaries for (1) street center lines and (2) hydrographic center lines.  Other features such as political boundaries and property boundaries do not appear to have been revised from the original TIGER line work, and are substantially less accurate.</horizpar>
      </horizpa>
      <vertacc>
        <vertaccr>A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable</vertaccr>
      </vertacc>
    </posacc>
    <lineage>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Dataset copied from the CD obtained from Washington DC, 2005

Census TIGER/line file imported into Arc Info Coverage format using the Arc Info 8.2 TIGER TOOL command.
Blocks were created by dissolving adjacent polygons as needed, and then exported to ESRI geodatabase format as a polygon feature class.  Resulting block polygons were then clipped to the DC boundary polygon available in the DC GIS planimetric data set.</procdesc>
        <procdate>2002</procdate>
      </procstep>
    </lineage>
  </dataqual>
